title: Everglades National Park: Burmese Pythons: Research
body: Burmese Pythons: Research       Nowhere else on the planet has such a large constrictor been introduced and established in a foreign locale as a result of the exotic pet trade. The invasive population of Burmese pythons in the Florida Everglades, therefore, requires resource managers to rely upon original scientific research and novel strategies to guide control efforts. Follow the links below to access additional resources on lessons learned and studies currently underway.         Fact Sheets           Burmese Pythons Fact Sheet April 2013 Hi-Res, 2 MB | Lo-Res, 300 KB             University of Florida IFAS Extension Fact Sheet English (PDF, 900 KB) Español (PDF, 900 KB)               Photos                   Burmese Pythons in the Everglades   10 Photos  Photographs documenting the ongoing efforts to control Burmese pythons in Everglades National Park.                              Publications          Giant Constrictors: Biological and Management Profiles and an Establishment Risk Assessment for Nine Large Species of Pythons, Anacondas, and the Boa Constrictor U.S. Geological Survey (PDF, 15 MB)      Avery, Michael L., et al.
